name: Rice (Padi)
description: Rice is a staple food crop grown in flooded fields, especially during the wet season. It requires high water and is a key crop in Sarawak's agriculture.

name: Black Pepper
description: Black pepper is a climbing vine cultivated for its spicy fruit. Sarawak is famous for its high-quality black pepper, which grows well year-round.

name: Durian
description: Durian is known as the 'king of fruits' in Southeast Asia. It produces large, spiky fruits with a strong aroma and creamy texture, typically harvested in the late dry to early wet season.

name: Pineapple
description: Pineapple is a tropical fruit with sweet, juicy flesh. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and can be grown throughout the year in Sarawak.

name: Kangkung (Water Spinach)
description: Kangkung, or water spinach, is a fast-growing leafy vegetable popular in Malaysian cuisine. It grows best in moist, nutrient-rich soils.

name: Bendi (Okra)
description: Bendi, or okra, is a warm-season vegetable valued for its edible green pods. It is easy to grow and commonly used in stir-fries and curries.

name: Lemongrass
description: Lemongrass is a fragrant herb used in cooking and traditional medicine. It grows well in tropical climates and is a staple in many Malaysian dishes.

name: Curry Leaf
description: Curry leaf is an aromatic herb essential in South Asian cooking. The leaves are used fresh for their distinctive flavor and aroma.

name: Orchid
description: Orchids are prized ornamental plants known for their beautiful and diverse flowers. They are popular in gardens and as houseplants in Sarawak.

name: Bougainvillea
description: Bougainvillea is a vibrant ornamental plant with colorful bracts. It is drought-tolerant and commonly used for landscaping and decorative purposes.
